section.p: The meeting with the problem was during an in-team competition, which problems are from HNOI. It was the only one which I had the idea on what the problem is. But I had no idea on the solution. After the test, one of my friends advised me to write out every pair of n and m. And I dit it. Then I had a sheet like this:

According to the limited data, we can find some interesting rules. First of all, it is obvious that the number of kinds of flowers equals 1 while m equals 0. Besides, when n equals 1 and m is greater than 0, the number of kinds of flowers is 2 times as large as m. What's more, when n is greater than 1 and m is greater than 0, the number of kinds of flowers equals the sum of the one with (n-1,m-1) and the one with (n,m-1). And that's the solution! I don't know how to prove it, but the when I submitted the problem with this solution, it returned an AC(Accepted).
